block.p: Jennifer Bolten Landry, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. C. Kevin Landry of Lincoln, Mass., was married yesterday to Khoa Pham Dang Le, the son of Mr. and Mrs. Co K. Le of Lakeside, Calif. The Rev. Edwin L. Holt, a nondenominational minister, officiated at the Palace Hotel in San Francisco.
The bride and bridegroom graduated from Harvard, where they met.

Jennifer Landry, Khoa Le Jennifer Bolten Landry, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. C. Kevin Landry of Lincoln, Mass., was married yesterday to Khoa Pham Dang Le, the son of Mr. and Mrs. Co K. Le of Lakeside, Calif. The Rev.Edwin L. Holt, a nondenominational minister, officiated at the Palace Hotel in San Francisco.

Jennifer Bolten Landry, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. C. Kevin Landry of Lincoln, Mass., was married yesterday to Khoa Pham Dang Le, the son of Mr. and Mrs. Co K. Le of Lakeside, Calif. The Rev. Edwin L. Holt, a nondenominational minister, officiated at the Palace Hotel in San Francisco.
The bride and bridegroom graduated from Harvard, where they met.

Mrs. Landry Le, 26, was until June an assistant teacher for the fifth grade at the Pacific Academy, a private school in Richmond, Calif. Next month she is to begin teaching math at Holy Child Middle School in Manhattan. Her father is the chief executive of TA Associates, an investment banking firm in Boston. Her mother, Barrie Landry, is the chairwoman of the fund-raising committee at Caroline Academy and Education Center, a Roman Catholic girls school in Boston.

Mr. Le, 25, is a securities trader at Morgan Stanley, the New York investment bank. His mother is a bilingual counselor for the Santee Unified School District in California. His father is a computer programmer at Alaris Medical Systems in San Diego.
